titlePart.entryReference: arrangements of seats for, or adaptation of seats to, vehicles

noteParagraph.text: The term "furniture" in this class also covers easels or stands, e.g. for blackboards or drawing tables.

titlePart.entryReference: chairs or multi-track cycles for invalids

titlePart.text: the parts, being the back-rest, or the back-rest and seat unit, having adjustable inclination
by means of a toothed rack or like gearing mechanism
by means of a peg-and-notch or pawl-and-cam mechanism
by means of clamps or friction locking members
for changing a straight chair into an easy chair
by changing the length or the inclination of the legs
the parts being movably-coupled seat and back-rest
the coupling member being a flexible strip
the parts including a leg-rest or foot-rest
in combination with movably coupled seat and back-rest
the combination with a leg-rest or foot-rest
with movably coupled seat and back-rest actuated by lazy tongs
Accessories not otherwise provided for, e.g. seats for children
Separate chairs, connectible together into a row
Devices for reserving or the like
Seats detachably mounted on stadium benches
Chairs or stools with rotatable or vertically-adjustable seats
with seat, or seat and back-rest unit, elastically mounted in a rigid frame
with a central column, e.g. rocking office chairs
with curved rocking members between seat and frame
with curved rocking members resting on the floor
with shell-shaped seat and back-rest unit, e.g. having arm-rests
of legless type, e.g. with seat directly resting on the floor
titlePart.entryReference: children's chairs mounted on back-rest of chair

titlePart.text: Chairs or stools with rotatable seat
Chairs or stools with vertically-adjustable seats
with balancing device, e.g. by spring, by weight
with clamps acting on vertical rods
with flexible height-adjusting means, e.g. rope, chain
with means, or adapted, for inclining the legs of the chair or stool for varying height of seat
with additional seat or additional legs for varying height of seat
Attachment of upholstery or fabric to frames
having a frame made of wood or plastics
with legs pivotably connected to seat or underframe
having a frame made of metal
with legs pivotably connected to seat or underframe
Folding chairs with flexible coverings for the seat or back elements
Attachment of upholstery or fabric to frames
having a frame made of wood or plastics
with legs pivotably connected to seat or underframe
having a frame made of metal
with legs pivotably connected to seat or underframe
Trunk chairs, i.e. chairs collapsible to trunk shape

titlePart.entryReference: of non-tubular folding, collapsible, or dismountable type

titlePart.text: Special adaptation of seat upholstery or fabric for attachment to tubular chairs
Tubular chairs of foldable, collapsible, or dismountable type
of plastics, with or without reinforcement
characterised by the use of laminated wood
Parts, details, or accessories of chairs or stools

titlePart.entryReference: adaptation of seats to mounting in tubular chairs
such parts not restricted to chairs

titlePart.text: Seats made of wooden, plastics, or metal sheet material
having foamed material included in cushioning part
Straps or the like for carrying upholstery
with tensioned springs, e.g. of flat type
with springs meandering in a flat plane
with tensioned cords, e.g. of elastic type, in a flat plane
with springs in compression, e.g. coiled
Combinations of different types of springs
Attachment of springs to other springs or to frame
Support for the head or the back
Supports for the feet or the legs
Parts or details of tipping-up chairs, e.g. of theatre chairs
Hinges, e.g. for mounting chairs in a curved row
Use of locks or ledges for limiting the seat movement
Adaptations for incorporating lamps, radio sets, bars, telephones, ventilation, heating or cooling arrangements or the like

titlePart.entryReference: walking sticks or umbrellas convertible into seats, hunting sticks

titlePart.text: Rests or supports for feet, legs, arms, back or head

noteParagraph.text: The term "bedstead" is used only for the frame of a bed; if the use of spring mattresses, stuffed mattresses, or similar means for enabling the lying of persons thereon is included, the term "bed" is used.
"Spring mattresses" do not include any stuffed material. It is not necessary that "stuffed mattresses" include metal springs but they may.

titlePart.entryReference: beds with special provisions for nursing

titlePart.text: Sofas, couches, settees, or the like, without movable parts
Sofas, couches, settees, or the like, with movable parts
changeable to beds by tilting or extending the arm-rests
changeable by increasing the available part, e.g. by drawing forward
changeable to beds by removing parts only
changeable to beds by tilting or pivoting the back-rest
with forward tiltable back-rest, e.g. back cushion
with coupled movement of back-rest and seat
with tilting or lifting seat-back-rest pivot
and tilting or pivoting the arm-rest
thereby uncovering one or more auxiliary parts previously hidden
with seat cushion consisting of superposed parts, at least one lower part being used to form part of the surface
the surface, when used for lying down, consisting of one side of the seat frame and the back-rest frame
with means for uncovering a previously hidden mattress or similar bed part
the lying down surface partly consisting of one side of the seat
with only one movable part being tiltable about a horizontal axis
having means to lift the tilting axis
two or more parts being rotatable about a vertical axis
Changing a single bed into a double bed by extending, pivoting, or tilting a previously hidden second mattress or other bed part
Joining seats, chairs, or couches to form beds
Changing corner couches into a double bed
Changing sofas or the like into beds by means of furniture other than seats or chairs
having balancing members, e.g. weights, springs
having supporting legs with fixed position on the floor, e.g. attached thereto
having means on the supporting legs facilitating the removal of the bed from its place
characterised by a rigid mattress-supporting member
characterised by two or more relatively-movable parts
characterised by their shape, e.g. multiple-wall beds
in which the cabinet or the like is tilted with the bed
pivotable on both horizontal and vertical axis
the cabinet being essentially changed in shape in sleeping position of the bed
Billiard table beds, or like beds

titlePart.entryReference: travelling or camp sacks or packs convertible into beds or mattresses

titlePart.text: the bed frame being foldable about a horizontal axis
the bed being foldable about a vertical axis
held in shape by stressed cords
adapted to be used in or connected to vehicles
Suspended beds, e.g. suspended from ceiling
Parts or details for beds, sofas or couches only not fully covered in a single one of the sub-groups , , , , , or

titlePart.entryReference: spring mattresses with rigid frame or forming part of the bedstead
bed jointing members or fittings for bedsteads

titlePart.text: Parts or details of bedsteads not fully covered in a single one of the following sub-groups, e.g. bed rails, post rails
Extensible bedsteads, e.g. with adjustment of length, width, height
Combinations of bedsteads with other furniture or with accessories, e.g. with bedside cabinets
Head-, foot-, or like rests for beds, sofas or the like
titlePart.entryReference: beds with invalid or nursing supports

titlePart.text: the adjustable part immobilising foldable legs
with means for adjusting two or more rests togehter
Attachments for beds, e.g. sheet holders, bed-cover holders
titlePart.entryReference: bed tables supported on the bedstead

titlePart.text: Ventilating means in connection with bedsteads
Devices for ventilating, cooling or heating
Devices for prevention against falling-out, e.g. detachable side walls
Spring mattresses with rigid frame or forming part of the bedstead

titlePart.entryReference: spring units forming part of stuffed mattresses

titlePart.text: using leaf springs, e.g. metal strips
using springs in compression, e.g. coiled
Connecting the springs to the frame
Attachment or interconnection of springs in frames or in spring units
Hangers or supports for fastening spring units to frame
using wooden springs, e.g. of slat type
using tensioned springs, e.g. of flat type
with braided or crossed flat springs or cords
with combinations of flat springs or link chains with wound springs
of tensioned rubber cords or like cords
using tensioned textile or other non-resilient strips
Connecting the springs to the frame
using combinations of springs covered by more than one of the groups , , and
Combinations of nets with springs in compression
with provisions for giving extra support for the head or the legs
without additional connecting means between the springs
Stuffed mattresses specially adapted for chairs, beds or sofas
Attachment of spring inlays to coverings
Use of stiffening sheets, lattices or grids under spring inlays
with foamed material in top, bottom, or side layers
Attaching, or interconnecting of, springs in spring inlays

titlePart.entryReference: connecting valves to inflatable elastic bodies in general

titlePart.text: with two or more independently-inflatable chambers
with fibrous inlays, e.g. made of wool, of cotton
consisting of two or more layers
reinforced with sheet-like elements, e.g. profiled
with springs moulded in, or situated in openings in foamed material
with both fibrous and foamed material inlays
Nets for protection against insects in connection with chairs or beds
Miscellaneous features in connection with chairs, beds, etc., e.g. upholstery fasteners, mattress protectors, stretching devices for mattress nets

titlePart.entryReference: quilting, quilting means, fastening, fixing or finishing upholstery

titlePart.text: Clamps for attaching flat elastic strips or flat meandering springs to frames
Measuring means for adapting chairs, beds or mattresses to the shape or weight of persons
titlePart.entryReference: body measuring means for clothing manufacture
